citation.article-title: Species identification of genus Bifidobacterium based on partial HSP60 gene sequences and proposal of Bifidobacterium thermacidophilum subsp. porcinum subsp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bifidobacterium thermacidophilum subsp. porcinum subsp. nov.
Bifidobacterium thermacidophilum subsp. porcinum (por.ci′num. L. neut. adj. porcinum of a hog).
All strains meet the species description.
l-Arabinose, inulin and d-mannose are not fermented.
Fermentation products from glucose are acetic and lactic acids at a molar ratio of 4·9 : 1.
The type strain, P3-14T (=AS 1.3009T=LMG 21689T), was isolated from the faeces of a piglet.
